newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: KIA GROUP SIGNS TO SELL 108.7 BLN WON WORTH ASSETS.
newsitem.headline: KIA GROUP SIGNS TO SELL 108.7 BLN WON WORTH ASSETS.

text.p: South Korea's financially troubled Kia Group said on Wednesday it had signed agreements to sell 108.7 billion won of its assets as of Tuesday.
The nation's eighth largest conglomerate announced last month it would sell 795 billion won worth of idle assets.
A Kia statement said Kia Group had reduced the number of its employees by 2,900 from a planned 8,835 since it was put under bankruptcy protection last month by its creditors.
The statement said Kia planned to cut the employee numbers by an additional 5,964 people by the end of this year.
The statement said Kia Group would be able to save 365.6 billion won because group executives planned to give up 60 percent of their annual wages and other employees 50 percent.
Kia planned to save another 719.6 billion won next year.
Kia Group announced early on Wednesday its Kia Precision Works would absorb sister company Kia Heavy Industries Co by next May.
Kia planned to reduce the number of its domestic subsidiaries to five from 28.
